Dan Holland gives his take on the value of the FA Cup ahead of next week's semi-finals and asks whether it can ever take priority over the Premier League. (Thumbnail credit Image: Flawka via flickr Creative Commons)

University hosts British Orienteering Championships

Last weekend saw York host two of the major events this year in the British Orienteering series, to determine the British elite sprint champion and middle distance champion. (Thumbnail credit Oli Johnson on his way to second place in the Sprint event, Image: Wendy Carlyle)

The rebirth of North East football

Rohan Banerjee examines the unexpected rise in fortunes of the North East's premier sides. (Thumbnail credit St James' Park has been a fortress for Alan Pardew's impressive Newcastle this season, Image: machernucha via flickr Creative Commons)

Why City must win the title

Dan Holland assesses the Premier League title race and why a Manchester City win is the best outcome for the neutral. (Thumbnail credit City boss Roberto Mancini celebrating their FA Cup win last season, Image: zawtowers via flickr Creative Commons)

Learning curve for York at national futsal finals

The futsal firsts suffered a set of frustrating results at the BUCS Futsal Trophy finals last Wednesday and Thursday. (Thumbnail credit York in action earlier this season)

Derwent champions as they blow away depleted Alcuin

Derwent were crowned college rugby champions as they thrashed an injury-hit Alcuin side 64-0.

Relegation despair for football firsts

York's footballers endured a dramatic defeat at the hands of Hull on Wednesday, consigning them to relegation. (Thumbnail credit Image: Andy Davis)

James strike late on to draw in league decider

James produced a stunning late comeback to earn a 3-3 draw with Halifax, securing top spot in this term's curtailed college football season in the process

Thomas and Lewis secure Goodricke win

In Saturday's re-arranged fixture, Goodricke secured a 2-0 win over Langwith thanks to goals from co-captain Matt Thomas and Sam Lewis.

Vanbrugh breeze past Wentworth

Vanbrugh finished off their spring league campaign with a comfortable 3-1 victory over Wentworth

Alcuin shock Derwent and show their College Cup credentials

On a glorious morning, Alcuin upset the odds in defeating the Winter Term College Champions Derwent, thanks to a superb goal from Alex Brown in the second half.

York Sport requests new funding for Autumn pre-season training camp

York Sport are putting together proposals to provide a pre-season training camp for the next academic year, it has been confirmed.

Successful end to season for Centurions

York Centurions secured their fifth win of the season to cap off a successful campaign, although this was followed by defeat in their final game

Brilliant James victorious in College Rugby 10s

James College's claim to be the 'rugby college' has taken some serious knocks over the past year, most notably after the sensational combination of defeat by Derwent in the rugby final and a disappointing fourth place finish in the 10s

Stalemate leaves football firsts close to drop zone

In a game of few chances on a sun-bathed 22 Acres, York knew that a win would mean escape from the threat of relegation from the BUCS Northern Conference 2B

Will Light speaks to the Swimming and Water Polo Club as they prepare for a move that will have huge implications (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Andrew Derlien give's his predictions for this year's Formula One Championship. (Thumbnail credit Image: nic_r via flickr Creative Commons)

Challenging time for York teams

The world of York Sport is non-stop at the minute, as we reach what Sir Alex Ferguson would call "squeaky bum time".

Victory over Durham gives women's hockey promotion chance

The women's hockey firsts gave themselves a chance of promotion with a hard-fought 2-0 victory over Durham on Monday night. (Thumbnail credit Image: Agatha Torrance)

Jubilant York through to Lacrosse final after classy display

A delighted York side proved their mettle today on 22 Acres, producing a great performance that allowed them to see off a strong Hull side and win a place in the BUCS Northern Conference Cup against Durham seconds.

Women's squash reach Cup Final with Newcastle win

York's women's squash firsts reached the final of the Northern Conference Cup today with a hard fought victory against Newcastle. (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Men's hockey defeat sets up tense finale

The men's hockey firsts collapsed to a 5-3 home defeat against Leeds seconds to set up a tense final round of fixtures at the bottom of their league.

Premier League Fatigue

Sean Cole examines Bolton's fall from grace and the absurdity of the Premier League. (Thumbnail credit Image: Gene Hunt via flickr Creative Commons)

College basketball roundup

Vanbrugh and Derwent took the spoils in an exciting evening of college basketball, defeating Langwith and James respectively.

Karting consistency key at Whilton Mill

The third and fourth rounds of the University Karting Championship were both run at one of the UK's most recognised kart circuits, Whilton Mill. (Thumbnail credit Andrew Gilmore leading the field.)

Men's badminton defeat Northumbria in tense affair

York's men's badminton firsts earned a dramatic victory over Northumbria on Wednesday to move them away from the threat of relegation.

York thirds held to draw in crunch game with Teesside

In what was effectively a title deciding match, York needed to win to draw level on points going into the last fixture of the season. Their general play warranted them taking all three points but somehow Teesside held on for a draw.

York swimmers break world record in day of success

The University of York's swimmers broke the world 100x100m Medley Relay world record in Manchester on Saturday.
